reviews.title: Enough memory
reviews.cardText: Fast, great screen, able to do lots more, enough memory for all tasks.

reviews.title: Best phone out there!
reviews.cardText: Camera, AI on photos, easy of use, flexibility to customise settings,

reviews.title: Great phone!
reviews.cardText:
I love my new phone! I will always be a Samsung Head. The screen design is perfect for fitting everything in one place. Difficult to type with 1 hand, although the settings make it possible to minimise the keyboard. 

I use my phone constantly through out the day and the battery life lasts all day. I have been exploring the camera settings to get the most from it and so far the camera is unparalleled. 

Performance wise, the phone is super fast, the screen is HD. Overall a great phone!

Not much difference to the s23 and s24 ultra.
I have had all 3 and the s24 ultra is better imo

reviews.cardText: Fantastic phone with all extra features sooper phone

reviews.cardText: Brilliant highly recommend ! Dont change anything perfect! Does not need upgrade.

reviews.title: Outstanding
reviews.cardText: Outstanding all round.  Easy to set up and use. Quick and really smooth.

reviews.title: Power packed and refined AI smartphone beast.
reviews.cardText: The all new Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra is a great phone with an all day battery and stunning camera. The anti glare bright display is visible even under sunlight and offer great day to day AI features. The design is great and light weight. The feel of premium and luxury is felt while holding the phone. The all new Snapdragon 8 elite processor offers blazing fast performance.Thumps up for Samsung.

review.title: A good alternative to iphones.
review.cardText: I have always had an iphone, and wasn't sure if i should ever try anything else as all other Androids in my opinion has a rubbish interface. But i was getting bored of using  iPhone, probably because i have always had them,  i thought i would give it a go as i am on o2 switch up and if i didn't like it i would just swap back to an iphone.  I have had the Samsung for a few weeks now and surprisingly i am enjoy it! The screen quality the customisation the build of it i think is really good! I would say the only down side i have found is that if you use it all the time you will need to charge it  after a good day's usage, and the camera is very slightly not as good as the iphone 16 pro max, but on the upside it does charge fairly quickly. It is worth giving it ago if you want something else than iphones. But it all depends on what you are looking for in your choice of a phone.

review.title: Amazing Phone
review.cardText: Buying the Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra from O2 was a smooth and hassle-free experience. The phone itself is incredible—stunning display, powerful performance, and a battery that easily lasts all day. The camera delivers excellent results, and the overall experience feels premium. O2’s deals made it even better, with great value and fast delivery. Highly recommend both the S25 Ultra and purchasing from O2.

photo.caption: Loving my new Galaxy S25 Ultra! Smooth, powerful, and stunning!

reviews.title: Samsung S25 ultra
reviews.cardText:
Love my samsung s25 ultra, the AI is the best part of the phone 
Under the hood, the Galaxy S25 Ultra is powered by the Snapdragon 8 Elite processor, delivering exceptional performance across applications. This robust chipset ensures that multitasking is fluid and responsive, catering to both productivity needs and entertainment desires. The integration of Galaxy AI further elevates the user experience, offering intelligent suggestions and automations that adapt to individual usage patterns, making daily interactions more intuitive and efficient.

review.title: Bit the bullet on the S24
review.cardText: I've only had my S24 Ultra 4 days, but I'm very impressed so far and have made sure to find out some hints and tips to use my new phone more productively. The screen is amazing, very colourful and has a high resolution. My last device was the Galaxy fold 3 i realy liked it but it's time for an upgrade after 3 years. I didnt want another folding phone not because they are bad but i wanted the better camera set up as I've got into photography more over the past 18 months, i have a nice camera but feel i can use the S24 ultra as a back up. The Fold 6 cameras are good just not as good as on the S24 ultra. I also really like the Square look on the S24 ultra heard the up coming S25 isn't so square in appearance so would look like every other phone on the market, so bit the bullet, i also got a good deal and reduced my bill, always a good thing.

review.title: SAMSUNG Galaxy S24 Ultra
review.cardText: The Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra is a high-end smartphone that excels in display quality, performance, and camera capabilities. It features a 6.8-inch Dynamic AMOLED 2X display with a 120Hz refresh rate, providing vibrant visuals and smooth interactions. The device is powered by either the Exynos 2400 or Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 processor, ensuring top-tier performance, and its versatile camera system includes a 200MP wide sensor, delivering exceptional photo and video quality.

review.title: Best phone ever and Brand
review.cardText: Phone works marvellously especially for what I got it for most of all which is the camera 100%

photo.caption: The case didn't come with it but the phone is pretty. Rubbish photo bc it's taken with my 5yr old phone.... don't judge the camera quality in these pics!!

review.title: It doesn't like my face.... but who does ;)
review.cardText: Phone is good, cameras are great. I wasn't sure on the colour at first, it's a bit pale but actually it looks better now the case is on and it's more pastel coloured than childish yellow.... although that option would still be cool!! Have a few problems with fingerprint recognition to log in but that might be due to the protector I've put on. Face recognition doesn't work for me but tbf my face is pretty miserable in the morning so it probably doesn't think it's me haha. Mobile data didn't work the first time I needed it but if you turn airplane mode on and off it sorts it out, well it did for me. You definitely need to get lens protectors for the cameras or they will get damaged really quickly.

photo.caption: Again that pic is rubbish but also amazing!
